name: Starter Pack
ideas: Become a food critic for your pantry. Write scathing reviews of each item as if they're competing for a Michelin star. That expired can of beans? Zero stars, no ambition.
Create a dramatic audiobook narration of your grocery list. Record yourself reading it with intense emotion, complete with suspenseful pauses before revealing 'milk.'
Start a support group for objects you've neglected. Gather the unused exercise equipment, forgotten craft supplies, and abandoned hobbies. Let them share their feelings.
Invent a new dance move and name it something ridiculous like 'The Confused Penguin' or 'The WiFi Buffering.' Teach it to absolutely no one.
Write a stern but fair performance review for your refrigerator. Evaluate its temperature consistency, lighting, and that weird noise it makes at 3 AM.
Compose a strongly-worded email to your past self about that haircut decision. CC your future self as a warning.
Create a nature documentary about the dust bunnies under your couch. Narrate their territorial disputes in a hushed, reverent tone.
Hold auditions for which of your shoes gets to be worn today. Make them compete with talent performances.
Write a formal resignation letter from your comfort zone. List your grievances and demand a severance package of snacks.
Start a podcast that only your houseplants can hear. Discuss topics they'd find riveting, like photosynthesis gossip.
Create a LinkedIn profile for your couch. Highlight its experience in professional lounging and supportive seating.
Host a press conference announcing your intention to finally fold that pile of laundry. Take no questions.
Write a choose-your-own-adventure story about making toast. Include at least three tragic endings involving burnt bread.
Develop a secret handshake with your reflection. Practice until you're perfectly synchronized.
Create a Yelp review for your bedroom, rating its sleep quality, ambiance, and proximity to snacks.
Hold a moment of silence for all the tabs you're about to close without reading.
Write a motivational speech for your alarm clock. It's just trying its best and nobody appreciates it.
Create a detailed floor plan for a tiny house you'd build for your favorite mug.
Host a roast for an appliance that has disappointed you. The toaster knows what it did.
Write fan mail to whoever invented elastic waistbands. They deserve recognition.
Create a training montage for yourself doing mundane tasks. Add dramatic music for maximum effect.
Develop a conspiracy theory about why one sock always goes missing. Present evidence to your family.
Write a theme song for your morning routine. Perform it daily with increasing theatricality.
Create a museum audio guide for interesting stains on your carpet. Each has a story.
Host a competitive championship for which blanket is the softest. Judge fairly but firmly.
Write a breakup letter to a food you've decided to stop eating. It's not you, it's your cholesterol.
Create a nature documentary about your neighborhood cats. Give them dramatic backstories.
Develop a rating system for different types of silence in your home. Rank them by eeriness.
Write a letter of recommendation for your favorite pen. Highlight its reliability and smooth ink flow.
Create a fake holiday celebrating something mundane, like 'Successful Parallel Parking Day.'
Host a therapy session between your phone and your attention span. They have issues to work through.
Write a screenplay for a heist movie where the target is the last cookie in the jar.
Create a fantasy map of your home, complete with dangerous territories like 'The Pile of Unsorted Mail.'
Develop an elaborate backstory for a random cloud you see outside. Where has it been? Where is it going?
Write a cease and desist letter to your brain for playing that one song on repeat.
Create a mock TED talk about the philosophy of putting things down and immediately forgetting where.
Host a debate between your responsible side and your 'just one more episode' side.
Write a dating profile for a lonely sock seeking its missing pair. Must enjoy warm environments.
Create a nature documentary about the wildlife in your refrigerator's vegetable drawer.
Develop a formal complaint process for when your body makes unexpected noises in public.
Write an apology letter to your younger self for not becoming an astronaut or dinosaur.
Create a soap opera storyline for the items on your bathroom counter. Drama is inevitable.
Host an intervention for your phone about its notification addiction. Set healthy boundaries.
Write a user manual for yourself. Include troubleshooting tips for bad moods.
Create a weather forecast for your emotional state today. Chance of snacks: 100%.
Develop a formal petition to make naps a recognized sport. Gather signatures from your pillows.
Write a movie trailer script for the epic journey of walking to the mailbox.
Create a loyalty rewards program for your most-used chair. It deserves recognition.
Host a spelling bee using only words you consistently misspell. Everyone loses.
Write a travel review for the journey from your bed to the bathroom at 3 AM.
Create a power ranking of the different water temperatures in your shower. Crown a champion.
Develop a sports commentary style for narrating your own cooking attempts.
Write a memoir from the perspective of your most neglected houseplant. It's seen things.
Create a court case where you prosecute yourself for crimes against your sleep schedule.
Host a book club meeting for books you own but haven't read. Discuss the covers extensively.
Write a formal treaty between you and your neighbor about acceptable noise levels.
Create a nature documentary about the ecosystem living in your keyboard.
Develop an awards ceremony for the best performances by inanimate objects this week.
Write a children's book about a stapler who dreams of becoming a hole punch.
Create a support group for people who say 'I should go to bed' but don't.
Host a talent show where you perform all the acts yourself in different costumes.
Write a letter to the moon asking why it's always following you. Demand answers.
Create a mock infomercial for a product that solves a problem only you have.
Develop a complex mythology explaining why your WiFi is slow today.
Write a ballad about the tragedy of a dropped ice cream cone. Perform it solemnly.
Create a reality TV show pitch about the drama in your sock drawer.
Host a wine tasting but with different brands of tap water. Note the subtle differences.
Write a manifesto about your right to eat cereal at any hour. It's a human right.
Create a detective noir story about finding who left the empty milk carton in the fridge.
Develop a formal curriculum for 'Advanced Procrastination Studies.' You'll finish it later.
Write a strongly-worded letter to gravity about that thing you dropped.
Create a compatibility quiz between yourself and various snack foods.
Host a red carpet event for your most glamorous outfit. Interview yourself about your look.
Write a survival guide for navigating family group chats. Include emergency protocols.
Create a mock documentary about the rise and fall of your New Year's resolutions.
Develop a secret agent persona for sneaking snacks past family members.
Write a formal request to the universe for more hours in the day. Specify what you'd do with them.
Create a power ballad about the emotional journey of assembling furniture without instructions.
Host a championship for competitive sighing. Judge on depth, duration, and emotional weight.
Write a character study of the version of you that exists in your rearview mirror.
Create a mock news broadcast about the events happening in your living room.
Develop a mythology about what happens to all your lost hair ties. They must go somewhere.
Write a recommendation letter for sleep, addressed to your stubborn brain.
Create a game show where contestants guess what's in your junk drawer. Prizes are junk.
Host a formal ceremony to retire a pen that has finally run out of ink.
Write a review of your own dreams like they're movies. Rate them out of five stars.
Create a nature documentary about the migration patterns of your car keys.
Develop a training program for your non-dominant hand. It's been slacking off.
Write a peace treaty between your need for coffee and your desire to sleep.
Create a mock archaeological dig of the items between your couch cushions.
Host a tasting menu of different leftover combinations. Rate each fusion creation.
Write a formal complaint to your legs about falling asleep at inconvenient times.
Create a soap opera about the love triangles between your kitchen utensils.
Develop a ranking system for the scariness of different shadows in your room at night.
Write a victory speech for successfully remembering why you walked into a room.
Create a mock trial where you defend your browsing history to an imaginary jury.
Host a competition for the best hiding spot in your home. You are the only contestant.
Write a letter to your future self warning them about the leftovers currently in the fridge.
Create a documentary about the secret society of coins that live in your car.
Develop a fitness challenge that only involves walking to the fridge and back.
Write a negotiation script between you and your bed about getting up on time.
Create a mock awards show for the best excuses you've made this year.
Host a philosophical debate about whether the light really goes off when the fridge closes.
Write a thriller screenplay where the twist is that you were the one who ate the leftovers.
Create a mock passport for traveling between rooms in your house.
Develop a formal complaint to your past self about that embarrassing thing from years ago.
Write a nature documentary about the territorial behavior of family members over the TV remote.
Create a ranking of your pillows based on their loyalty and fluffiness.
Host a mock job interview for a nap. Assess its qualifications thoroughly.
Write a dramatic monologue from the perspective of your dying phone battery.
Create a workout routine that consists entirely of dramatic poses and power stances.
Develop a detailed conspiracy theory about why your favorite show was cancelled.
Write a strongly-worded complaint to whichever ancestor gave you your least favorite trait.
Create a mock United Nations summit for the items fighting for space in your freezer.
Host a ceremony awarding yourself for outstanding achievement in doing the bare minimum.
Write a self-help book title for a problem only you seem to have.
Create a dramatic reading of your text message history with one person. Add accents.
Develop a secret code language using only sounds your stomach makes.
Write a formal business proposal for why you deserve more naps.
Create a nature documentary about yourself in your natural habitat: the couch.
Host a mock cooking competition using only ingredients currently in your fridge.
Write a villain origin story for yourself that began with a minor inconvenience.
Create a power ranking of which limbs you'd miss most if they fell asleep permanently.
Develop an elaborate excuse for why you didn't text back. Make it cinematic.
Write a theme park map for the attraction that is your daily routine.
Create a mock infomercial for a blanket that's always the perfect temperature.
Host a debate tournament between your various streaming services. Which reigns supreme?
Write a diplomatic letter to the fly that won't leave your room. Negotiate terms.
Create a training program for teaching yourself to whistle. Document the failures.
Develop a ranking of your facial expressions from most to least useful.
Write a sequel to a dream you had but give it a better ending.
Create a mock campaign speech for running for president of your household.
Host an awards ceremony for your most impressive feats of laziness this month.
Write a survival guide for the treacherous journey from bed to shower on cold mornings.
Create a detailed analysis of your snacking patterns. Present findings in graph form.
Develop a mythology about where the other earbuds go when one stops working.
Write a formal invitation to yourself for a fancy dinner that's actually just leftovers.
Create a mock documentary about your evolving relationship with your hairbrush.
Host a speed dating event between yourself and different hobbies you've abandoned.
Write a script for a commercial selling your current mood. Find the unique selling points.
Create a ranking of household chores by how dramatically you can procrastinate them.
Develop a secret identity for yourself that only activates when no one is watching.
Write a nature documentary about the wildlife that lives in your shower drain.
Create a formal peace accord between your sleep schedule and your screen time.
Host a mock trial for the clothing item that always ends up on the floor.
Write a motivational poster quote about the struggle of finding matching tupperware lids.
Create a detailed map of all the places you've said 'I'll remember this' and didn't.
Develop a scoring system for how satisfying different sneezes are.
Write a ballad about the one charger that actually works for all your devices.
Create a mock interview with yourself about your five-year plan. Watch yourself improvise.
Host a ceremony for the grand opening of a drawer you finally organized.
Write a strongly-worded review of the last time you stubbed your toe.
Create a mockumentary about the drama of deciding where to eat dinner.
Develop a training montage for getting better at pretending to listen.
Write a love letter to a meal that changed your life. Even if it was just good pizza.
Create a power ranking of which rooms in your home have the best vibes.
Host a mock Olympics for skills nobody asked for, like untangling cords.
Write a nature documentary about your morning self versus your night self.
Create a formal complaint to the concept of Mondays. Demand they be rescheduled.
Develop an elaborate theory about what your pets think you do all day.
Write a mock autobiography chapter about the time you almost did something impressive.
Create a ranking system for the intensity of different types of hunger.
Host a debate between your optimistic morning plans and your realistic evening outcomes.
Write a screenplay for a buddy comedy starring you and your most reliable appliance.
Create a mock travel brochure for visiting the magical land of 'Outside.'
Develop a formal complaint process for when songs get stuck in your head.
Write a nature documentary about the complex social dynamics of your family dinners.
Create a power ranking of which snacks are worth getting up for.
Host a mock press conference about a minor life update. Take questions from stuffed animals.
Write a breakup text to a habit you're trying to quit. Be firm but compassionate.
Create a detailed analysis of your procrastination techniques. Rank them by effectiveness.
Develop a mythology about the ancient civilization that left crumbs in your keyboard.
Write a formal invitation for yourself to finally try that thing you've been avoiding.
Create a mock courtroom drama about who forgot to buy more toilet paper.
Host a championship for competitive channel surfing. Crown yourself the winner.
Write a survival guide for navigating awkward silences. Include emergency conversation topics.
Create a nature documentary about your behavior when home alone versus when people visit.
Develop a ranking of your excuses by creativity and believability.
Write a motivational speech from your blanket encouraging you to stay in bed.
Create a mock escape room using only puzzles found in your daily routine.
Host a formal ceremony for the first sip of coffee in the morning. It deserves reverence.
Write a dramatic retelling of the last time you ran to catch a closing elevator.
Create a compatibility test between yourself and various types of weather.
Develop a mock documentary about the rise and fall of your attention span.
Write a formal apology to your plants for the weeks you forgot they existed.
Create a power ranking of the creepiest sounds your house makes at night.
Host a mock awards show for the best lies you've told to avoid plans.
Write a nature documentary about the predator-prey relationship between you and deadlines.
Create a detailed analysis of your relationship with the snooze button. Seek therapy.
Develop a formal petition to make 'I don't know, what do you want to eat' a valid answer.
Write a mock interview with the version of yourself that makes plans you don't want to keep.
Create a ranking of your socks by their contribution to your overall happiness.
Host a competition for the most creative way to avoid doing dishes.
Write a screenplay for a thriller where the call is coming from inside your own brain.
Create a nature documentary about your behavior during different stages of hunger.
Develop a formal complaint to your brain about those 3 AM random memories.
Write a mock true crime podcast about the mystery of who keeps finishing the good snacks.
Create a formal business plan for a company that sells excuses. Develop your product line.
Host a retrospective meeting about your week, complete with action items you'll ignore.
Write a nature documentary about the territorial disputes between apps fighting for your home screen.
